Package com.xebisco.yield

Class YldGame

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.xebisco.yield.YldB
      • com.xebisco.yield.YldScene
        • com.xebisco.yield.YldGame
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    Main, Test2
    public class YldGame
extends YldScene
    This class is the starting point for every Yield Game, it contains all the objects of the game.
    Since:
    4_alpha1

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field Description
      protected YldScene scene
      The actual scene that is displaying.
      protected java.util.ArrayList<YldScene> scenes
      All the scenes that are in this YldGame instance.

      • launch

                          GameConfiguration configuration)
        This is the method that will create an YldGame instance receiving a GameConfiguration variable, it will set all the game based in the GameConfiguration instance.
        Parameters:
        game - The YldGame to be created.
        configuration - The YldGame instance of the GameConfiguration class.
        Since:
        4_alpha1

      • launch

        public static void launch​(YldGame game)
        This function launches the game.
        Parameters:
        game - The game object.

      • updateScene

        public final void updateScene​(float delta,
                              java.util.Set<Renderable> renderables)
        Update the scene, and if it's the first frame, call the create() method on all systems and the scene itself. The first thing we do is check if the scene has been updated before. If it hasn't, we call the create() method on all systems and the scene itself. This is done by checking if the system implements the SystemCreateMethod interface, and if it does, we call the create() method on it.
        Parameters:
        delta - The time in seconds since the last frame.
        renderables - A TreeSet of Renderable objects.

      • setRenderProperty

        public void setRenderProperty​(java.lang.String property,

        value - The value to set the field to.

      • globalUpdate

        public void globalUpdate​(float delta)
        This function is called every frame, not mattering what scene the game is on.
        Parameters:
        delta - The time in seconds since the last update.

      • processFilters

        public Engine processFilters​(Texture texture,
                             int fps,
                             boolean stopAfterSame)
        It creates an engine that processes the filters on a texture
        Parameters:
        texture - The texture to process
        fps - The frames per second of the engine.
        stopAfterSame - If true, the engine will stop after the texture is the same as the past colors.
        Returns:
        An engine that processes the filters on the texture.

        public void setTexturePixels​(Texture texture,
                             Color[][] colors)
        Sets the colors of the pixels of the given texture to the given colors.
        Parameters:
        texture - The texture to set the pixels of.
        colors - A 2D array of colors. The first dimension is the x coordinate, the second is the y coordinate.

      • loadFont

        public void loadFont​(java.lang.String fontName,
                     float size,
                     int format,
                     RelativeFile fontFile)
        Loads a font from a file, and if the file is marked to be flushed after load, flush it.
        Parameters:
        fontName - The name of the font.
        size - The size of the font.
        format - 0 = Vector, 1 = Bitmap.
        fontFile - The file that contains the font.

      • loadFont

        public void loadFont​(java.lang.String fontName,
                     float size,
                     float sizeToLoad,
                     int format,
                     RelativeFile fontFile)
        Loads a font from a file, and if the file is marked to be flushed after load, flush it.
        Parameters:
        fontName - The name of the font.
        size - The size of the font to be loaded.
        sizeToLoad - The size of the font to load.
        format - The format of the font file. This can be one of the following:
        fontFile - The file to load the font from.

                     int style)

        Parameters:

        size - The size of the font.

      • getScene

        public YldScene getScene​(java.lang.Class<? extends YldScene> type)
        If the hashcode and name of the class of the scene at index i is equal to the hashcode and name of the class of the type parameter, return the scene at index i.
        Parameters:
        type - The class of the scene you want to get.
        Returns:
        The scene that matches the type.

      • setScene

        public <T extends YldScene,​P extends YldProgressScene> void setScene​(java.lang.Class<T> type,
                                                                           java.lang.Class<P> progressScene,
                                                                           ChangeScene how)
        Set the scene to the given type, and use the given progress scene to load it.
        Parameters:
        type - The scene to change to.
        progressScene - The scene that will be displayed while the assets are being loaded.
        how - What to do with last scene.

      • setScene

        public <T extends YldScene,​P extends YldProgressScene> void setScene​(java.lang.Class<T> type,
                                                                           java.lang.Class<P> progressScene)
        Set the scene to the given type, using the given progress scene, and destroy the last scene.
        Parameters:
        type - The class of the scene you want to change to.
        progressScene - The class of the progress scene to be displayed while the scene is loading.

        Parameters:
        type - The scene type to be instantiated.
